intro: Davejonesia, commonly known as the white-flowered tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and clusters of white, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are not only ornamental but also attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Davejonesia is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic value and pleasant fragrance.
